intro: Thymus robustus, commonly known as robust thyme, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, characterized by its square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. Its leaves are narrow, fragrant, and covered in fine hairs, which contribute to its medicinal and culinary uses. Thymus robustus thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy and drought-tolerant species.
